stanza.line: When to the sessions of sweet silent (a)thought(/a)
I summon up remembrance of things (b)past(/b)
I sigh the lack of many a thing I (a)sought(/a)
And with old woes new wail my dear time's (b)waste(/b)
Then can I drown an eye (unused to (c)flow)(/c)
For precious friends hid in death's dateless (d)night(/d)
And weep afresh love's long since cancelled (c)woe(/c)
And moan th' expense of many a vanished (d)sight(/d)
Then can I grieve at grievances (e)foregone(/e)
And heavily from woe to woe tell (f)o'er(/f)
Which I new pay as if not paid (f)before(/f)
But if the while I think on thee (dear (g)friend)(/g)
All losses are restored and sorrows (g)end(/g)
